author: UMA GUPTA
title: India installed about 14 GW of solar in 2022
contents:
India installed approximately 13,956 MW of solar capacity and 1,847 MW of wind capacity in the twelve months ending December 31, 2022. This is about 17.5% and 26.6%, respectively, higher than in 2021, according to JMK Research analysts.
The new solar addition of 13,956 MW comprised 11.3 GW of utility-scale solar, about 47% higher than in 2021. Rooftops added about 1.9 GW (42% less than in 2021) and off-grid/distributed nearly 700 MW.

Most of the large-scale solar capacity in 2022 was installed in the states of Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Tamil Nadu.
The nation reached 120.85 GW of cumulative renewables installations, as per the data released by India’s Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) till December 2022. Solar energy contributes around 52% share of the overall RE mix, followed by wind energy (35%), bio-power (9%), and small hydro (4%).

author: UMA GUPTA
title: REIL tenders 50 MW rooftop solar on government buildings
contents:
Rajasthan Electronics & Instruments Ltd (REIL) has invited bids to develop an aggregate 50 MWp of grid-connected rooftop solar capacity on government buildings in different states and union territories of India. The plants are to be developed under the RESCO model.
The selected developer’s scope of work includes site survey, design, manufacture, supply, erection, testing, and commissioning of the rooftop solar PV power system, along with the associated power evacuation and transmission system. It will also provide operation and maintenance support for 25 years.
The ceiling tariff is INR 5.15/kWh for sites falling under general category states and union territories and INR 6.25/kWh for sites falling under special category states and union territories.

author: UMA GUPTA
title: REC commits $123 million for renewable energy projects in Madhya Pradesh
contents:
State-owned non-banking finance company REC Ltd has signed a memorandum of understanding with Rewa Ultra Mega Solar Ltd. (RUMSL) to provide financial assistance of INR 1,000 crore ($123 million) for the development of renewable energy parks and associated infrastructure including power evacuation in Madhya Pradesh. 
RUMSL has been designated as a solar power park developer in Madhya Pradesh by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE). 
Madhya Pradesh aims to generate 20% of its electricity through renewable sources by the financial year 2024, 30% by FY 2027, and 50% by FY 2030.
Additionally, REC, in partnership with World Bank, has designed a financing facility for select state-owned electricity distribution companies. As a part of this REC-World Bank program, the total volume of financing available shall be $1 billion. Under this umbrella, REC committed an amount of INR 5,000 crore to MP Discoms.
